Detailed Description

Listener for selecting a share target.

The IShareTargetHandleListener interface is used to handle selected target.

It called when a share target has been selected. The client can decide whether to perform some action.

The following example demonstrates how to use the IShareTargetHandleListener 

 class MyHandleListener : public gaia::ui::IShareTargetHandleListener {
 private:
      gaia::core::Page* mpPage;
 public:
      explicit MyHandleListener(gaia::core::Page* page);
      virtual ~MyHandleListener();
      virtual bool onHandle(gaia::core::Demand* demand);
 };

 bool MyHandleListener::onHandle(gaia::core::Demand* demand) {
      // your implementation
 }

 void MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const p) {
      mDemand = new Demand(Demand::ACTION_SEND());
      mpShareWidget = new ShareWidget(Context(this));
      mpShareWidget->setShareDemand(*mDemand);

      // instantiate handle listener
      mpHandleListener = new MyHandleListener(this);
      // set to ShareWidget
      mpShareWidget->setOnHandleListener(mpHandleListener);
 }

IShareTargetHandleListenerProxy* gaia::ui::IShareTargetHandleListener::getProxy ( )
virtual bool gaia::ui::IShareTargetHandleListener::onHandle ( gaia::core::Demand *  demand) [pure virtual]

Called when a share target has been selected.

Parameters:
demandThe demand for launching the chosen share target.
Returns:
If true, the demand is handled by client and the client ignore the default behavior. If false, perform the default behavior.
